marketNews.title: Minor Evaluation of IHSG, BBRI Weight Increases 2.25 Percentage Points
marketNews.content: BEI on 24 June 2024 announced the results of a minor evaluation of the IHSG index for the effective period 1 July-30 September 2024. The evaluation includes changes in the weight of several stocks in the index, with Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) experiencing the most significant weight increase of 2.25 percentage points, rising from 6.75% to 9%. To determine a stock's weight in the IHSG, BEI uses a free-float adjusted index and applies a maximum cap of 9%. In the previous evaluation in March 2024, BBRI had a weight of 9%. However, a decline in BBRI's share price over the last three months caused its weight to fall to 6.75% before the June 2024 evaluation. The increase in BBRI's weight in the June 2024 evaluation was driven by a higher maximum amount of free-float shares calculated by BEI for weighting. Previously, the free-float shares of BBRI used in the March 2024 evaluation were 43.4 billion shares, which corresponded to the 9% weight cap at that time. In the June 2024 evaluation, the free-float shares of BBRI rose to 60 billion shares, reaching the maximum weight of 9%. Although the calculated free-float shares increased, BBRI still has uncounted free-float shares because the free-float shares of BBRI as of May 2024 reached 70.1 billion shares. After BBRI, the other issuers with the largest weight increases were TPIA (+0.12 percentage point) and MDKA (+0.08 percentage point). The largest weight decreases were recorded by AMRT (-0.27 percentage point), BMRI (-0.24 percentage point), and AMMN (-0.16 percentage point). The next evaluation of the IHSG index will be carried out in September 2024, with the effective period 1 October-31 December 2024. Key Takeaway: This weighting can affect investors, especially institutional investors who use the IHSG as a benchmark or passive institutional investors tracking the index. Since the announcement of the new index weighting on 24 June 2024, BBRI's share price has risen about +11% as of 4 July 2024. Additionally, foreign investors recorded a net buy of IDR 550 billion in BBRI shares on 28 June, one day before the effective period of the evaluation. It is important to note that there are still free-float shares of BBRI that have not been counted for IHSG weighting. Consequently, if BBRI's weight drops in the future due to a price decline, the BBRI weight could rise again.

marketNews.title: US Democratic Party Considers Kamala Harris as Potential Replacement for President Biden
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the Democratic Party in the United States is considering Vice President Kamala Harris as the primary alternative to replace President Joe Biden in the election campaign if Biden decides to step aside. Previously, Biden's poor performance and incoherent statements during the debate against Donald Trump raised concerns within the Democratic Party about his health and suitability for a second term.

marketNews.title: Kadin Deputy Chairman Calls for Selective 200% Import Tariff Policy
marketNews.content: Deputy Chairman of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin), Juan Permata Adoe, urged the government to be more selective in imposing a 200% import duty on products. He warned that a non-selective approach could hinder domestic industries if the 200% duty is applied to raw materials and auxiliary inputs that are not yet produced in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister Says Renewable Energy Investment Lagging, Targets 23% EBT Mix by 2025
marketNews.content: The Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Enia Listiani Dewi, stated that the lack of significant investment in the new and renewable energy (EBT) sector is one of the reasons the target of a 23% EBT mix by 2025 is difficult to achieve. In 2023, the EBT mix was only 13.1%. She explained that investment obstacles stem from the Domestic Component Level (TKDN) and collaboration issues. To address the problem, the Ministry of Industry and the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources will issue a ministerial regulation before the current administration ends.

marketNews.title: Garuda Indonesia CEO Requests Removal of Upper Fare Cap
marketNews.content: The President Director of Garuda Indonesia (GIAA), Irfan Setiaputra, asked the Ministry of Transportation to eliminate the Upper Fare Cap (TBA) ticket policy. He noted that the TBA, which has not been increased since 2019, has caused the average fare per passenger for GIAA to decline.

marketNews.title: Kominfo Director General of Applications and Informatics Resigns Over Ransomware Attack
marketNews.content: The Director General of Applications and Informatics at the Ministry of Communication and Information Technology, Semuel Abrijani Pangerapan, announced his resignation. He explained that the decision was a form of responsibility for the ransomware attack on the Temporary National Data Center.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Superbank Receives Rp1.2 Trillion Capital Injection
tickerNews.content: EMTK: The digital bank entity owned by Elang Mahkota Teknologi, PT Super Bank Indonesia (Superbank), received an additional investment of IDR 1.2 trillion from Grab, Singtel, and KakaoBank. Superbank President Director Tigor M. Siahaan said the additional investment will strengthen the company in expanding financial services and financing for underbanked MSMEs in Indonesia. Previously, at the end of June 2024, Superbank launched a feature integrated with Grab, allowing users to open an account within the ride-hailing application.

tickerNews.title: MIDI Reports Strong Same-Store Sales Growth in 1H24
tickerNews.content: MIDI: Midi Utama Indonesia recorded same-store sales growth (SSSG) of +9.64% year-on-year during the first half of 2024, surpassing the 2024 management guidance of +6% YoY and marking the highest growth since 2022. In the second quarter of 2024, SSSG was +6.10% YoY (versus 1Q24: +13.67% YoY) as the market normalized after Ramadan. During 1H24, MIDI opened 75 new Alfamidi stores (vs. 27 in 1H23), representing 37.5% of the 2024 target of 200 new stores.

tickerNews.title: SRTG Insiders Purchase Shares as Part of Long-Term Incentive Program
tickerNews.content: SRTG: Saratoga Investama Sedaya directors Lany Djuwita Wong and Devin Wirawan each bought 836,700 and 831,500 shares of SRTG at a price of IDR 1,480 per share on 1 July 2024. The total transaction value for both purchases was approximately IDR 2.5 billion. After the transactions, Lany Djuwita Wong's ownership in SRTG increased from 0.03% to 0.04%, while Devin Wirawan's ownership rose from 0.04% to 0.05%. The transactions are part of the implementation of the company's long-term incentive program.

tickerNews.title: PANI Announces 90% Progress on Hotel Nusantara Project in IKN
tickerNews.content: PANI: The Company Secretary of Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua, Christy Grassela, told Kontan that the construction progress of the Hotel Nusantara in the new capital (IKN) has reached 90% and will commence operations soon. Hotel Nusantara is being built by PT Kusuma Putra Alam, in which PANI holds an 11.12% stake. In the initial phase, the hotel is targeted to have 100 rooms.

tickerNews.title: BRMS Targets 35,000 Troy Ounces Gold Production in 2024
tickerNews.content: BRMS: Bumi Resources Minerals' director Herwin Hidayat said the company is optimistic about meeting its 2024 gold production target of 35,000 troy ounces, which is a 50.4% increase over the 2023 realization of 23,270 troy ounces. The optimism is supported by the completion of a new gold processing plant with a capacity of 4,000 tons of ore per day in Palu, Central Sulawesi, scheduled for the second half of 2024. Currently, BRMS operates two gold plants in Palu, each with capacities of 500 tons and 4,000 tons of ore per day. The company is also developing a 2,000-ton-per-day ore processing plant in Gorontalo, targeted for completion in June 2026.

tickerNews.title: TSPC Shareholder Bogamulia Nagadi Increases Stake to 87.62%
tickerNews.content: TSPC: Tempo Scan Pacific's controlling shareholder, PT Bogamulia Nagadi, purchased approximately 1.42 million TSPC shares at an average price of IDR 1,960.3 per share on 19 June 2024. The total transaction value was about IDR 2.8 billion. After the transaction, PT Bogamulia Nagadi's ownership in TSPC rose from 87.58% to 87.62%.

tickerNews.title: TMAS Secures Rp300 Billion Loan for Capex Expansion
tickerNews.content: TMAS: Temas obtained a loan of IDR 300 billion from its controlling shareholder, PT Temas Lestari, with a repayment term until 31 December 2025. The loan is intended for capital expenditures to increase the company's operational capacity.
